intro: Ceropegia laikipika, commonly known as the Laikipia ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers a warm, sunny environment. Due to its unique appearance and growth habits, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
